instruction: How does the accuracy and performance of the proposed method using the MLP algorithm compare to traditional methods in monitoring floating macroalgae blooms (MAB) in the Yellow Sea?
Output: The accuracy and performance of the proposed method using the MLP algorithm in monitoring floating macroalgae blooms (MAB) in the Yellow Sea is higher and more robust compared to traditional methods. The method utilizes two MLP models that consider both spectral and spatial features of Rayleigh-corrected reflectance (R-rc) maps. The accuracy assessment and performance comparison showed that the proposed method has the capability to provide prediction maps of MAB with high accuracy, with an F1-score approaching 90% or more. This indicates that the method can accurately detect and monitor MAB in the Yellow Sea. Additionally, the proposed method is more robust than traditional methods, as it does not require other reliable indicators or visual inspection to achieve acceptable mapping of MAB under diverse environmental conditions such as cloud, aerosol, and sun glint. Furthermore, the model is adaptable for other ocean color instruments, allowing customized models to be built and used for monitoring MAB in any regional areas.
